streaming operators
  • ostream & operator<< (ostream &s, const CStatistic &Img)
    writes the statistical information to stream, the user must ensure that it is available by a previous successful call to a DeriveStats method.

Detailed Description

CStatistic calculates minimum, maximum, mean, standard deviation and a histogram for a given image, Last updated 9/9/2002.

Note that a histogram is not created for the CFloatImage type.

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
0.80
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen edr@mip.sdu.dk

Member Function Documentation

template<class POLY>
bool ipl::CStatistic::DeriveStats (  const vector< POLY > &    Values )  [inline]
 

Derives statistical information for the values contained in the given vector.

The vector type can be any of the primitive types such as int, float, and double. No histogram is created.

Parameters:
PixelGroup  The pixelgroup to calculate statistics for.
Returns :
False, if the pixelgroup is empty or if no colors are available.

Derives statistical information for the given pixelgroups color values.

No histogram is created.

Parameters:
PixelGroup  The pixelgroup to calculate statistics for.
Returns :
False, if the pixelgroup is empty or if no colors are available.

Definition at line 174 of file statistic.cpp.

References ipl::CPixelGroup::GetConstTPixelGroupPtr().

bool ipl::CStatistic::DeriveStats (  const CStdImage &    Image ) 
 

Derives statistical information for the given integer image.

A histogram with 65536 entries is created. Indexing is from -32768 to 32767 (min and max values for the INT16 type).

Parameters:
Image  The image to calculate statistics for.
Returns :
False, if the image is empty.

Definition at line 126 of file statistic.cpp.

UINT32 * ipl::CStatistic::GetHistogramPtr (    ) 
 

A pointer to the histogram is returned.

Note that the indexing from the returned pointer is different depending on the original image. For an CIntImage the indexing is from -32768 to 32767 (min and max values for the INT16 type), for a CStdImage with 1 b/p it is from 0 to 1, and for a CStdImage with 8 b/p it is from 0 to 255. If statistics is not yet calculated or if no histogram is available (see the DeriveStats methods) an error message is produced.

Returns :
Pointer to the histogram array or NULL if not available.
